main event: A disc-shaped, silver-gray object approximately 60-70 feet in diameter was observed hovering over Lake Erie near Sandusky, Ohio on September 8, 1961.
interesting points: The object hovered for one minute before accelerating rapidly and disappearing to the north.
A photograph was taken but no image was visible, suggesting the object moved too fast to be captured.
The observation was made by a reliable witness, but no unusual background sounds were reported.
Chemical analysis of samples found in the area revealed man-made materials like aluminum and polystyrene, but the origin could not be determined.
Several other sightings of unidentified flying objects were reported in the Sandusky area around the same time.
location: Over Lake Erie, 15 miles northwest of Sandusky, Ohio
photographs: one photograph taken, but no image visible
